text: if you're not suffering the
accomplishments probably not as high if
you don't feel like you've really
exerted yourself at the end of the day
you kind of think to yourself why was I
on the bike for nine hours this is the
Red Rock Canyon store the mileage for
the trip five days four hundred miles
comes out to about 80 miles a day starts
in Grand Junction Colorado and finishes
at Lake Powell I'm 67 years old and been
doing some active cycling for probably a
good 10 to 12 years I really enjoy these
kinds of tours like this where that are
just spectacular scenery all these
panoramic views and stuff like that and
meet new people good food maybe some
beer and wine and all that good stuff
we're gonna be riding in some areas that
are very remote very remote there's
nothing out here for big stretches and I
marked on these sheets where you
actually will find anything so if you're
out there by yourself just make sure you
always carry enough water and enough
food to be out there for say fifty mile
stretch originally I was going to do the
112 which includes a twelve percent
grade at the 90 mile point I'm right now
more inclined to do the 88 because this
is a major climbing day 5,000 feet of
climbing this is like the mega day
so today was a tough ride partly because
it was so hot almost impossible to get
enough water into you know you probably
need to be drinking three or four water
bottles a an hour but it's pretty much
impossible we're kind of looking forward
to maybe a little bit of rain today to
cool us off but never it never really
tried every once in a while I get a drop
I wasn't sure whether it was a raindrop
or a bird was pooping on me thank God I
made it and the rest of it thanks to all
these folks it towed me along we made it
through almost one hundred and eight
miles to Lake Powell I'm glad I did it
I'm glad it's over and I don't look at
my bike for a few days the stories that
are rehashed at over the dinner table in
57 years are usually about how bad it
was and how awful I felt they may not
know it then that they're going to have
a story to tell and they're going to
appreciate it but eventually they do
